trans-unit.source: %VO2max% is a scientific metric for the maximal oxygen uptake that is highly correlated with one's maximal running performance. Still, two athletes with equal %VO2max% values do not need to perform equally as their efficiency may differ. Instead of the exact %VO2max% (which can be measured in a lab), the combination of %VO2max% and running efficiency is of intereset. The resulting Effective %VO2max% can be used as direct predictor for upcoming running events.
trans-unit.target: %VO2max% является научной метрикой максимального усвоения кислорода, который в большой степени коррелирует с максимальной беговой производительностью. В тоже время, два атлета с одинаковым значением %VO2max% не обязательно показывают одинаковый соревновательный результат, поскольку может различаться их эффективность. Вместо чистого %VO2max% (который можно измерить лабораторно), интерес представляет комбинация %VO2max% и беговой эффективности. Полученный таким образом Эффективный %VO2max% можно использовать как точный предсказатель результата предстоящего соревнования.

trans-unit.source: Absolute values of ATL are hard to interpret, as preferred values vary from athlete to athlete depending on their current level. Instead of showing absolute values, Runalyze uses the alltime maximum ATL to express current ATL as percentage. In this way, ATL values are always relative to the athlete's maximum. Still, if an athlete was overtraining once, reaching 100% ATL is not recommended.
trans-unit.target: Absolute values of ATL are hard to interpret, as preferred values vary from athlete to athlete depending on their current level. Instead of showing absolute values, Runalyze uses the alltime maximum ATL to express current ATL as percentage. In this way, ATL values are always relative to the athlete's maximum. Still, if an athlete was overtraining once, reaching 100% ATL is not recommended.

trans-unit.source: Actual Training Load
trans-unit.target: Фактическая тренировочная нагрузка

trans-unit.source: Actual Training Load represents your current degree of fatigue, being an exponentially weighted average of your training load (i.e. %trimp%) over a period of 7 days by default.
trans-unit.target: Фактическая тренировочная нагрузка характеризует степень усталости, является экспоненциально взвешенным средним вашей тренировочной нагрузки (т.е. %trimp%) за 7 дней, по умолчанию.

trans-unit.source: As absolute heart rates may relate to different intensities depending on the maximum, all heart rate related calculations are based on relative heart rates and thus require an appropriate maximum heart rate to be given.
trans-unit.target: Поскольку абсолютное значение частоты сердечных сокращений может относиться к разным интенсивностям в зависимости от максимума, все вычисления, связанные с сердечным ритмом, основаны на относительной частоте сердечных сокращений и, следовательно, требуют предоставления максимальной частоты сердечных сокращений.

trans-unit.source: As everybody’s heart rate may behave differently, Runalyze uses an additional individual correction factor which is calculated based on one's best race and its heart rate automatically. Alternatively, athletes can pick a manual correction factor.
trans-unit.target: Поскольку частота сердечных сокращений у каждого может вести себя по-разному, Runalyze использует дополнительный индивидуальный поправочный коэффициент, который рассчитывается на основе результата лучшего забега и частоты сердечных сокращений автоматически. В качестве альтернативы, спортсмены могут выбрать поправочный коэффициент вручную.

trans-unit.source: By default, these calculations are based on the training of the last six months, while the kilometres made a week count 2/3 and the long distance runs account for 1/3 of the 'Marathon shape'. These parameters can be changed individually by every athlete.
trans-unit.target: По умолчанию эти расчеты основаны на тренировках за последние шесть месяцев, километры недельного пробега составляют 2/3, а длинные забеги - 1/3 «формы марафона». Эти параметры могут быть изменены индивидуально каждым спортсменом.

trans-unit.source: Caution
trans-unit.target: Осторожно

trans-unit.source: Chronic Training Load
trans-unit.target: Постоянная тренировочная нагрузка

trans-unit.source: Chronic Training Load represents your current degree of fitness, being an exponentially weighted average of your training load (i.e. %trimp%) over a period of 42 days by default.
trans-unit.target: Постоянная тренировочная нагрузка характеризует текущую степень тренированности, является экспоненциально взвешенной средней тренировочной нагрузкой (т.е. % Trimp%) в течение 42 дней (по умолчанию).

trans-unit.source: Danger
trans-unit.target: Опасность

trans-unit.source: Does not improve cardiorespiratory fitness. This is suitable for recovery and developing endurance.
trans-unit.target: Не улучшает кардиореспираторную форму. Это подходит для восстановления и развития выносливости.

trans-unit.source: Does only increase cardiorespiratory fitness if adequate recovery is applied afterwards.
trans-unit.target: Улучшает только кардиореспираторную форму, только если после этого осуществляется адекватное восстановление.

trans-unit.source: Easy TRIMP
trans-unit.target: Легкий ТРИПМ

trans-unit.source: Easy TRIMP is the maximal allowed TRIMP for the following day that will keep TSB at 0, i.e. keeps a balanced training stress.
trans-unit.target: Легкий %TRIMP% - это максимально допустимый %TRIMP% на следующий день, который будет поддерживать TSB на 0, т.е. сохранит сбалансированную тренировочную нагрузку.

trans-unit.source: Every athlete has to test his maximal heart rate as it's highly individual and common rules of thumb may be far off for a single person.
trans-unit.target: Каждый спортсмен должен выяснить свой максимальный пульс, поскольку он очень индивидуальный, а общие правила могут быть далеки от истины для конкретного человека.

trans-unit.source: Extreme caution
trans-unit.target: Крайняя осторожность

trans-unit.source: Extreme danger
trans-unit.target: Крайняя опасность

trans-unit.source: Extremely hard
trans-unit.target: Очень тяжело

trans-unit.source: Extremely light
trans-unit.target: Очень легко

trans-unit.source: Fatigue is possible with prolonged exposure and activity. Continuing activity could result in heat cramps.
trans-unit.target: Усталость возможна при продолжительном воздействии и активности. Продолжение активности может привести к тепловым судорогам.

trans-unit.source: Glossary
trans-unit.target: Глоссарий

trans-unit.source: Hard
trans-unit.target: Тяжело

trans-unit.source: Heart rate variability
trans-unit.target: Вариабельность сердечного ритма

trans-unit.source: Heart rate variability (HRV) is the physiological phenomenon of variation in the time interval between heartbeats and is measured by the variation in the beat-to-beat interval (commonly stated as R-R interval). It is well known that HRV is directly related to the body's interdependent regulatory systems and can be a powerful measure for an athlete's recovery status.
trans-unit.target: Изменчивость сердечного ритма (ИСР) является физиологическим явлением изменения временного интервала между сердечными сокращениями и измеряется изменением интервала между ритмами (обычно обозначается как интервал R-R). Хорошо известно, что ИСР напрямую связан с взаимозависимыми регуляторными системами организма и может ярко характеризовать степень восстановления спортсмена.

trans-unit.source: Heat cramps and heat exhaustion are likely; heat stroke is probable with continued activity.
trans-unit.target: Возможны тепловые судороги и тепловое истощение; при продолжении активности вероятен тепловой удар.

trans-unit.source: Heat cramps and heat exhaustion are possible. Continuing activity could result in heat stroke.
trans-unit.target: Возможны тепловые судороги и тепловое истощение; продолжение активности может привести к тепловому удару.

trans-unit.source: Heat index
trans-unit.target: Индекс жары

trans-unit.source: Heat index levels
trans-unit.target: Уровени индекса жары

trans-unit.source: Heat stroke is imminent.
trans-unit.target: Тепловой удар неизбежен.

trans-unit.source: Highly improves cardiorespiratory fitness, but requires easier workouts to balance the training.
trans-unit.target: В большой степени улучшает кардиореспираторную форму, но требует более легких следующих тренировок, чтобы сбалансировать нагрузку.

trans-unit.source: Highly improving training effect
trans-unit.target: Значительно повышает тренировочный эффект

trans-unit.source: If an important race is ahead, TSB should be clearly positive. As levels of CTL and ATL differ from athlete to athlete, no concrete suggestions can be made.
trans-unit.target: Если предстоит важная гонка, TSB должен быть строго положительным. Так как уровень CTL и ATL различаются от атлета к атлету, четких рекомендаций дать нельзя.

trans-unit.source: Improves cardiorespiratory fitness.
trans-unit.target: Улучшает кардиореспираторную форму.

trans-unit.source: Improving training effect
trans-unit.target: Улучшает тренировочный эффект

trans-unit.source: In Runalyze, windchill is a metric for the apparent temperature that takes the Wind Chill effect into account.
trans-unit.target: В Runalyze, windchill - параметр для кажущейся температуры, которая учитывает охлаждающий эффект ветра.

trans-unit.source: Light
trans-unit.target: Легкий

trans-unit.source: Maintaining training effect
trans-unit.target: Поддержание тренировочного эффекта

trans-unit.source: Maintains cardiorespiratory fitness and builds foundation for more demanding workours in future.
trans-unit.target: Поддерживает кардиореспираторную форму и создает основу для более тяжелых тренировок в будущем.

trans-unit.source: Marathon shape
trans-unit.target: Готовность к марафону

trans-unit.source: Maximal exertion
trans-unit.target: Максимальное напряжение

trans-unit.source: Maximum heart rate
trans-unit.target: Максимальный пульс

trans-unit.source: Measuring resting heart rate each day as part of a morning ritual is recommended for athletes. Increases in resting heart rate can indicate stress and overtraining.
trans-unit.target: Спортсменам рекомендуется измерять пульс покоя каждый день в рамках утреннего ритуала. Увеличение пульса покоя может указывать на стресс и перетренированность.

trans-unit.source: Metrics for HRV
trans-unit.target: Показатели для ВСР

trans-unit.source: Minor training effect
trans-unit.target: Незначительный тренировочный эффект

trans-unit.source: Monotony
trans-unit.target: Монотонность

trans-unit.source: Natural logarithm of RMSSD
trans-unit.target: Натуральный логарифм от RMSSD

trans-unit.source: No effect
trans-unit.target: Нет эффекта

trans-unit.source: No exertion at all
trans-unit.target: Никакой нагрузки

trans-unit.source: No training effect
trans-unit.target: Отсутствие тренировочного эффекта

trans-unit.source: Notice: This calculation is based on the sum of the *all day* TRIMP value. It is based on the overall strain made a day, no matter which kind of activity has been done.
trans-unit.target: Примечание. Этот расчет основан на сумме значения TRIMP за весь день. Он основан на общем напряжении за день, независимо от видов активности.

trans-unit.source: Overtraining
trans-unit.target: Перетренированность

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Обзор

trans-unit.source: Performance condition
trans-unit.target: Эффективность тренировки

trans-unit.source: Performance condition is a metric provided by Garmin that analyzes pace, heart rate and heart rate variability within the first 20 minutes of an activity to make a real-time assessment of your ability to perform compared to your current fitness level.
trans-unit.target: Эффективность тренировки - это метрика, предоставляемая Garmin, которая анализирует темп, сердечный ритм и вариабельность сердечного ритма в течение первых 20 минут активности, чтобы в реальном времени оценить вашу готовность к нагрузкам, в сравнении с вашим текущим уровнем тренированности.

trans-unit.source: Performance condition values range from +20 to -20, whereby positive values mean that you are rested and in shape for a good and intense workout.
trans-unit.target: Эффективность тренировки варьируются от +20 до -20, при этом положительные значения означают, что вы отдохнули и в форме для хорошей и интенсивной тренировки.

trans-unit.source: Proportion of successive R-R intervals that differ by more than %s ms
trans-unit.target: Доля последовательных интервалов R-R, которые отличаются более чем на %s мс

trans-unit.source: RPE scale
trans-unit.target: Шкала RPE

trans-unit.source: Rate of Perceived Exertion
trans-unit.target: Степень воспринимаемого напряжения

trans-unit.source: Rated Perceived Exertion (RPE) is a quantitive measure for the physical exertion of an activity. this rating is frequently used in studies and is measured by the Borg rating or RPE scale. The range of 6-20 follows the heart rate of a healthy young adult (by multiplying with 10).
trans-unit.target: Rated Perceived Exertion (RPE) is a quantitive measure for the physical exertion of an activity. this rating is frequently used in studies and is measured by the Borg rating or RPE scale. The range of 6-20 follows the heart rate of a healthy young adult (by multiplying with 10).

trans-unit.source: References
trans-unit.target: References

trans-unit.source: Resting heart rate
trans-unit.target: Resting heart rate

trans-unit.source: Root mean square of successive differences
trans-unit.target: Root mean square of successive differences

trans-unit.source: Runalyze estimates the Effective %VO2max% for every run with heart rate data based on the relation of heart rate and pace. Optionally, elevation can be taken into account as well. The average of these values will be used as the athlete's current shape.
trans-unit.target: Runalyze estimates the Effective %VO2max% for every run with heart rate data based on the relation of heart rate and pace. Optionally, elevation can be taken into account as well. The average of these values will be used as the athlete's current shape.

trans-unit.source: Runalyze reads training effect values only when importing *.fit-files (provided that the file contains a training effect value).
trans-unit.target: Runalyze reads training effect values only when importing *.fit-files (provided that the file contains a training effect value).

trans-unit.source: Runalyze tries to estimate the athlete's limit by current ATL and gives a coloured (green/orange/red) feedback.
trans-unit.target: Runalyze tries to estimate the athlete's limit by current ATL and gives a coloured (green/orange/red) feedback.

trans-unit.source: Runalyze will always use the activity's complete heart rate profile, if available, to correctly rate interval workouts.
trans-unit.target: Runalyze will always use the activity's complete heart rate profile, if available, to correctly rate interval workouts.

trans-unit.source: Runalyze will import performance condition from fit files if available.
trans-unit.target: Runalyze will import performance condition from fit files if available.

trans-unit.source: SWOLF is a metric of swimming efficiency and is calculated as sum of time (in seconds) and stroke count for a given distance (traditionally the pool length, i.e. 50m). Stroke count is used as an indicator of effort, but it's not always a good one.
trans-unit.target: SWOLF is a metric of swimming efficiency and is calculated as sum of time (in seconds) and stroke count for a given distance (traditionally the pool length, i.e. 50m). Stroke count is used as an indicator of effort, but it's not always a good one.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Similar to %atl%, Runalyze uses the alltime maximum CTL to express current CTL as percentage.
trans-unit.target: Similar to %atl%, Runalyze uses the alltime maximum CTL to express current CTL as percentage.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, SWOLF cycles is calculated as sum of time (in seconds) and stroke cycles (i.e. number of hand entries only on one side). Some people prefer SWOLF cycles as metric for finding one's most efficient swimming style.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, SWOLF cycles is calculated as sum of time (in seconds) and stroke cycles (i.e. number of hand entries only on one side). Some people prefer SWOLF cycles as metric for finding one's most efficient swimming style.

trans-unit.source: Somewhat hard
trans-unit.target: Somewhat hard

trans-unit.source: Standard deviation of R-R intervals
trans-unit.target: Standard deviation of R-R intervals

trans-unit.source: Standard deviation of the average R-R intervals calculated over 5 minutes
trans-unit.target: Standard deviation of the average R-R intervals calculated over 5 minutes

trans-unit.source: Suggestion
trans-unit.target: Suggestion

trans-unit.source: Temperature and humidity should not have any effect.
trans-unit.target: Temperature and humidity should not have any effect.

trans-unit.source: The SWOLF score is useful when trying different combinations of stroke rate and stroke length to find the most efficient one, but it's not meaningful for comparing different swimmers.
trans-unit.target: The SWOLF score is useful when trying different combinations of stroke rate and stroke length to find the most efficient one, but it's not meaningful for comparing different swimmers.

trans-unit.source: The Wind Chill effect describes the rate of heat loss from the human body resulting from the combined effect of low temperature and wind. As winds increase, heat is carried away from the body at a faster rate, driving down both the skin temperature and eventually the internal body temperature.
trans-unit.target: The Wind Chill effect describes the rate of heat loss from the human body resulting from the combined effect of low temperature and wind. As winds increase, heat is carried away from the body at a faster rate, driving down both the skin temperature and eventually the internal body temperature.

trans-unit.source: The body's heart rate is measured in beats per minute [bpm] and its maximal possible value is defined as maximum heart rate. Athlete's heart rates must always be considered relatively to their maximum, normally stated as [%HRmax].
trans-unit.target: The body's heart rate is measured in beats per minute [bpm] and its maximal possible value is defined as maximum heart rate. Athlete's heart rates must always be considered relatively to their maximum, normally stated as [%HRmax].

trans-unit.source: The heat index as an index that combines air temperature and relative humidity to determine the human-perceived equivalent temperature. The resulting apparent temperature is crucial to assess possible effects of the weather for the human body. High relative humidity reduces the evaporation rate of sweat, lowering the body's self-cooling.
trans-unit.target: The heat index as an index that combines air temperature and relative humidity to determine the human-perceived equivalent temperature. The resulting apparent temperature is crucial to assess possible effects of the weather for the human body. High relative humidity reduces the evaporation rate of sweat, lowering the body's self-cooling.

trans-unit.source: The heat index is calculated based on temperatures in the shade. Exposure to full sunshine can increase heat index values by up to %temp%.
trans-unit.target: The heat index is calculated based on temperatures in the shade. Exposure to full sunshine can increase heat index values by up to %temp%.

trans-unit.source: The logarithm is used to achieve a better scaling.
trans-unit.target: The logarithm is used to achieve a better scaling.

trans-unit.source: The marathon shape is an invention of Runalyze to optimize prognoses for long distances, that are based on the effective VO2max. These prognoses normally can't consider whether the athlete has the optimal fitness or endurance for a marathon. The marathon shape is the solution for this problem, as the prognoses are continually adjusted for missing fitness.
trans-unit.target: The marathon shape is an invention of Runalyze to optimize prognoses for long distances, that are based on the effective VO2max. These prognoses normally can't consider whether the athlete has the optimal fitness or endurance for a marathon. The marathon shape is the solution for this problem, as the prognoses are continually adjusted for missing fitness.

trans-unit.source: The resting heart rate is defined as the heart rate when a person is awake and at complete rest. Well-conditioned endurance athletes typically have lower resting heart rates (e.g. 30 - 50 bpm) than unathletic people (e.g. 50 - 90 bpm).
trans-unit.target: The resting heart rate is defined as the heart rate when a person is awake and at complete rest. Well-conditioned endurance athletes typically have lower resting heart rates (e.g. 30 - 50 bpm) than unathletic people (e.g. 50 - 90 bpm).

trans-unit.source: The training effect is a measure by Firstbeat and Garmin to evaluate the training's ffort concerning the impact on the physiology, in particular future aerobic performance. Garmin devices analyze heart rate data during activity to estimate EPOC (excess post-exercise oxygen consumption) and determine the related training effect. Training effect values are useful to control one's weekly training to prevent overtraining.
trans-unit.target: The training effect is a measure by Firstbeat and Garmin to evaluate the training's ffort concerning the impact on the physiology, in particular future aerobic performance. Garmin devices analyze heart rate data during activity to estimate EPOC (excess post-exercise oxygen consumption) and determine the related training effect. Training effect values are useful to control one's weekly training to prevent overtraining.

trans-unit.source: The training monotony is a method for evaluating the similarity of the daily training and is based on the variation of the daily TRIMP values over the last seven days. The lower the variation the higher the monotony. Results underneath 1.5 are considered as recommendable, results above 2.0 as critical. To recognise overtraining, one should bear training strain in mind as that value rates monotony and training load together.
trans-unit.target: The training monotony is a method for evaluating the similarity of the daily training and is based on the variation of the daily TRIMP values over the last seven days. The lower the variation the higher the monotony. Results underneath 1.5 are considered as recommendable, results above 2.0 as critical. To recognise overtraining, one should bear training strain in mind as that value rates monotony and training load together.

trans-unit.source: The training strain calculates the risk of overtraining by combining training monotony and the sum of all TRIMP values for a given period. The risk of overtraining has an individual limit for every single athlete.
trans-unit.target: The training strain calculates the risk of overtraining by combining training monotony and the sum of all TRIMP values for a given period. The risk of overtraining has an individual limit for every single athlete.

trans-unit.source: This value is said to be a strong indicator for parasympathetic activity and thus large values indicate a better recovery status.
trans-unit.target: This value is said to be a strong indicator for parasympathetic activity and thus large values indicate a better recovery status.

trans-unit.source: To calculate the marathon shape, the kilometers made a week aswell as every single run according to length are looked at. Other physical activities (e.g. cycling) are not going to be considered. The target is set to a calculated value according to the athlete's current best possible marathon time, based on the VO2max. The kilometers and the distance of the weekly long run are derived from typical marathon training plans.
trans-unit.target: To calculate the marathon shape, the kilometers made a week aswell as every single run according to length are looked at. Other physical activities (e.g. cycling) are not going to be considered. The target is set to a calculated value according to the athlete's current best possible marathon time, based on the VO2max. The kilometers and the distance of the weekly long run are derived from typical marathon training plans.

trans-unit.source: Training Effect Levels
trans-unit.target: Training Effect Levels

trans-unit.source: Training Impulse
trans-unit.target: Training Impulse

trans-unit.source: Training Impulse, developed by Banister in 1991, is a method to quantify training load based on heart rate and duration of an exercise. The method uses heart rate reserve, which considers %restingHeartRate% as well as %maximumHeartRate%, and a gender-specific weighting factor.
trans-unit.target: Training Impulse, developed by Banister in 1991, is a method to quantify training load based on heart rate and duration of an exercise. The method uses heart rate reserve, which considers %restingHeartRate% as well as %maximumHeartRate%, and a gender-specific weighting factor.

trans-unit.source: Training Stress Balance
trans-unit.target: Training Stress Balance

trans-unit.source: Training effect
trans-unit.target: Training effect

trans-unit.source: Training strain
trans-unit.target: Training strain

trans-unit.source: Training stress balance is the difference between CTL and ATL (in absolute values) and can help as indicator for hard training (negative values) and rest (positive values).
trans-unit.target: Training stress balance is the difference between CTL and ATL (in absolute values) and can help as indicator for hard training (negative values) and rest (positive values).

trans-unit.source: Very hard
trans-unit.target: Very hard

trans-unit.source: Very light
trans-unit.target: Very light

trans-unit.source: Windchill
trans-unit.target: Windchill

trans-unit.source: per week
trans-unit.target: per week
